# ggroove

There are two colors in my head. But we'll need a few more to make plots. 

`ggroove` is a package of ggplot2 color palette functions based on album art. 

The first entry is from Radiohead

`scale_fill_radiohead_d(album = "kid_a")` will create a discreate fill palette

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(ggroove)
library(palmerpenguins)

penguins %>%
  ggplot(aes(body_mass_g,flipper_length_mm, fill =  bill_length_mm)) +
  geom_point(shape = 21) +
  scale_fill_radiohead_c(album = "in_rainbows")


penguins %>%
  ggplot(aes(body_mass_g,flipper_length_mm, fill =  island)) +
  geom_point(shape = 21) +
  scale_fill_radiohead_d(album = "king_of_limbs")

gapminder::gapminder %>%
  ggplot(aes(lifeExp, fill =  continent)) +
  geom_histogram(show.legend = TRUE, color = "black") +
  scale_fill_radiohead_d(album = "amnesiac") +
  theme_minimal()
```
